definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Thede-non starch lipid can improve the storage stability of the brown rice.
sentences.chinese: 脱去非淀粉脂能改善糙米储藏稳定性。

sentences.english: The nurse disrobed the elderly patient expertly.
sentences.chinese: 护士熟练地脱去了较老病人的衣服。

sentences.english: The hills and dales are stripped of mantles of snow.
sentences.chinese: 山冈和山谷脱去了积雪的斗篷。

sentences.english: And he changed his prison garments, and he ate bread before him always all the days of his life.
sentences.chinese: 脱去他的囚衣，以后一生日日与王共进饮食。

sentences.english: The Queen disrobed after the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王在仪式过后脱去了王袍。

sentences.english: Some will sit shirtless proudly displaying large elaborate tattoos. At first, a sense of ordered calm pervades the festival.
sentences.chinese: 有些人会脱去上衣，骄傲地展示大型的精细纹身。

sentences.english: They don’t put their working clothes off before going to sleep…
sentences.chinese: 直到夜深他们才会脱去工服入睡。

sentences.english: Lie not one to another: stripping yourselves of the old man with his deeds.
sentences.chinese: 你们原已脱去了旧人和他的作为。

sentences.english: The Queen disrobed after the coronation ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王在仪式过后脱去了王袍。

sentences.english: Result The tobacco mosaio virus was eliminated from plantlets of shoot -tip culture.
sentences.chinese: 结果怀地黄茎尖培养苗已脱去地黄黄斑病毒。

definition: to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to strip naked/to strip nude/(coll.) to find oneself a partner
to wrap tightly/to wind tightly/to bind/close-fitting (clothes)
